intro: Festuca varia var. pungens, commonly known as the curly fescue, is a perennial grass native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and distinctive, curling leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained, moist soils. It is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its ornate foliage and ability to form dense mats. Festuca varia var. pungens is relatively low maintenance and can tolerate partial shade to full sun.
